description.narrative: Esm3ni ampliﬁes youth voice and agency, strengthens community media, builds critical thinking skills while producing and disseminating positive alternative narratives and youth-led media content. In a whole-of-community approach, the project engages community leaders, building the capacity of educators, local government institutions, and civil society to engage and to act as positive mentors to youth-led media projects. By building students’ media production skills and providing them with practical media experience, the program increases youth job-readiness and opens new employment opportunities. Esm3ni is funded by the ministry of foriegn affairs of the Netherlands. IREX will implement the program in partnership with a public university and a national NGO.

mailing-address.narrative: AL HAJAR AL ASWAD BLDG-Oﬃce 304 125 MECCA ST. AMMAN, JORDAN

recipient-country.narrative: Esma'ni program is targeting young jordanians aged between 18-24. Mainly residing in Irbid city. But will also target young people from middle region such as Amman, Zarqa, Salt and Sabahb

sector.narrative: ESM3NI also aims at building capacities of Youth to be more conscientious consumers of information and creators of vibrant information. This quarter youth were able to produce 5 radio programs consisting of 6 episodes each. Programs tackle violent extremism through highlighting its push and pull factors.

ESM3NI builds the capacities of a state university (Yarmouk university), by provisioning of highly needed equipment and building capacities of young volunteers (aged between 18-24), and training of faculty members on facilitation skills using Esma'ni curricula.

ESM3NI's overall objective is : Jordanian youth are more empowered & resilient to propaganda. Youth engaged in discussions related to their own community issues, that motivated them to deal with diversity in a more positive manner. In addition, this quarter Esma'ni established a partnership with Jordanian civil society organisation; The Jordan Hashemite Fund for Human Development (JOHUD).

title.narrative: Increase in participants radio production skills

description.narrative: Increase in skill proficiency of Esma'ni youth radio production skills: presentation, content, research, technical editing and mastering.

title.narrative: % increase in radio production skills proficiency

description.narrative: based on pre and post evaluation

title.narrative: Yarmouk University Faculty and civil society activists improve facilitation skills and build PVE capacity and skills.

description.narrative: The Esma'ni facilitators who had attended a four day TOT during the first quarter of the program recieved a one-day facilitator refresher on the 29th September in Amman. Twenty facilitators attended the refresher, where the curriculum was revisited.

title.narrative: Yarmouk University faculty members and youth activists improvement of facilitation skills on Esma'ni curricula.

description.narrative: Each facilitator had the opportunity to practice his/her own facilitation skills and recieved constructive feedback by their peers and the Esma'ni team, who also evaluated the progress in their facilitation skills using a breakdown sheet of a list of facilitation competency skills and comparing it to the same breakdown sheet that was used to evaluate their skills during the first TOT practice in March.

title.narrative: Yarmouk FM content analysis baseline survey

description.narrative: To assess progress made on Yarmouk FM media content, IREX has engaged 15 members of the Yarmouk FM Listeners cluband trained them on IREX's Media Content Analysis Tool (MCAT), which they used during this quarter period to assess the current programs on Yarmouk FM.

title.narrative: Yarmouk FM programs content quality baseline

description.narrative: Assessed in terms of; objectivity, relevance, creativity, accuracy and technical proficiency. Each indicator was scored out of 5, therefore giving a total score out of 25.

title.narrative: Number of youth participating in radio production training

description.narrative: Youth participation in radio production training. Topics include: community radio, investigative journalism, research and resources, scriptwriting for factual radio, technical production and post production.

title.narrative: Young participants attending radio production training

description.narrative: Youth-led radio programs tackling violent extremism pull and push factors
Radio programs produced by number of episodes for each program

title.narrative: % improvement of youth participants knowledge in radio production

description.narrative: youth participants gained knowledge in radio production through training and weekly assignments.
Percentage change in youth knowledge in radio production topics in both content and technical areas.
